law.catch_line: Duties of adjutant general -- Authority to enter into agreements with federal agencies.

text.section: The adjutant general, or his or her designee, may enter into any federal contracts, federal grants, and federal agreements with the United States of America, by and through the Department of Defense, Department of the Army, Department of the Air Force, National Guard Bureau, Federal Aviation Administration, United States Department of Homeland Security, and Federal Emergency Management Agency, and any other division, department, or agency of the federal government, as may be deemed necessary to carry out the general intent and purposes of the Department of Military Affairs.
